snippet: More than three million New York households — over half the state’s renters and one-third of homeowners — cannot afford their homes, the state comptroller’s office disclosed.
abstract: New York State comptroller's office reports that housing costs have risen beyond what New Yorkers can afford in many parts of the state, whether they rent or own; report finds that more than half the state’s renters, and a third of homeowners, now devote more than 30 percent of their income to housing, surpassing the threshold of what the federal government considers to be affordable.
lead_paragraph: More than three million New York households — over half the state’s renters and one-third of homeowners — cannot afford their homes, the state comptroller’s office disclosed.

headline.main: New York State Reports Steep Rise in Housing Costs
headline.print_headline: State Reports Steep Rise in Housing Costs
